taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For Mariano Martínez de Galinsoga, 1766–1797, court physician and director of the Botanic Garden, Madrid]

bio:treatment.discussion: Galinsoga is closely related to Sabazia Cassini of Mexico and South America and to at least some members of Alloispermum Willdenow, primarily from South America. Galinsoga might best be treated as a single larger genus including Alloispermum and Sabazia (J. M. Canne 1978; J. L. Panero et al. 1999).

references.reference: Canne, J. M. 1977. A revision of the genus Galinsoga (Compositae: Heliantheae). Rhodora 79: 319–389.
Canne, J. M. 1978. Circumscription and generic relationships of Galinsoga (Compositae: Heliantheae). Madroño 25: 81–93.

key_statement.description: Phyllaries persistent; inner paleae 3-lobed, lobes 1 / 3 + total lengths, acute; disc pappi 0, or of 15–20 often gray, sometimes white, linear, fimbriate, obtuse scales 0.5–2 mm.

Phyllaries falling; inner paleae entire or 2- or 3-lobed, lobes to 1 / 3 total lengths, blunt; disc pappi 0, or of 1–5 or 14–20 white, lanceolate to oblanceolate, fimbriate, sometimes aristate, scales.
